name: ComBat-seq
description: Performs experimental batch correction using ComBat-seq software (https://academic.oup.com/nargab/article/2/3/lqaa078/5909519). Note that to preserve differences unrelated to technical/batch artifacts, you should also specify sample annotations like phenotype, treatment, etc. in your annotation table. Also note that this will NOT fix poorly designed experiments where experimental factors like treatment groups are confounded with batch.

raw_counts.description: A table/matrix of integer counts from an RNA-seq experiment. These should NOT be normalized in any manner and hence we only accept integer counts.
raw_counts.name: Raw counts:

annotations.description: An annotation table describing your experimental setup. The first column has the sample names. Below, you will select which column contains the batch covariate you wish to control for. Any additional columns should specify other experimental factors/covariates you want to preserve (treatment groups, phenotype, etc). Without these, the batch adjustment risks removing important effects you may be interested in.
annotations.name: Sample annotations:

batch_variable_choice.description: The name of the column which contains your batch variable. Any additional columns should specify other experimental factors/covariates you want to preserve (treatment groups, phenotype, etc). Without these, the batch adjustment risks removing important effects you may be interested in.
batch_variable_choice.name: Batch covariate:
